Lunch was so-so, salad was a generous portion. Lunch plates seemed to be big volume - but I would have preferred a smaller portion with fresher & better quality veggies.

My morning waitress and afternoon waiter were both friendly and attentive. Steve's is convenient and flexible for people of all tastes.
The salad was great but there grilled chesse was terrible. The waiter was hardly around to get a refill

Really good meatloaf soft and flavorful. Topped with chunky tomato sauce. We had the chocolate money. Omg was it good. Crispy egg rolls filled with Ghirardelli chocolate and a ripe banana fried crispy then rolled in cinnamon and sugar. Served with three scoops of vanilla ice cream and topped with chocolate sauce. The crackle of crispy egg roll yummy

We happened to stop in here after checking in at the Hyatt on New Years Eve. They had a great musician playing out on the sidewalk so we took a seat on the patio. Bonus for the hubby that they had a couple of "smoking tables". Had a few beers and enjoyed the sidewalk show before heading out for the evening. Nice place to get a quick drink if you are staying at the Hyatt and don't want to pay the hotel prices. Intended to stop in when we got back at the end of the evening but unfortunately they were already closed. I will definitely look them up next time I'm downtown in the area.

Food was decent at best and the service was beyond subpar. I had to pretty much ask for my server to come back after waiting close to ten minutes so I can order and I was maybe one of five or six people there. After he took my order he never came back to check on me and I once again had to ask someone else for my check.

A solid three stars from me. I come to Phoenix every year for a conference, and have been coming here for 6 years now. It is always consistent. While I have always had breakfast, service and food are good. Nothing that really jumps out and says "I would drive a thousand miles through a gasoline fire to eat here, you have to try this!", but it beats the highway robbery prices at the hotel. Someday, I will try lunch or dinner and report back.
Love this place it is fantastic. The owner Kathy runs this place very well and if you go on a Fri or Sat night and Blaine Long is playing then you are in for a treat.

This diner was absolutely atrocious. The service was extremely rude and when I attempted to get the waitresses attention she lashed out at me and refused to serve my fiancé and I. I will no longer be going to Steve's greenhouse Grill for breakfast which was a tradition for my fiancé and to go on Sundays because this woman was so rude and treated us this way. The food was cold on multiple occasions. Don't waste your time and money.

Rad decor and certainly catches your attention if you're walking on the street. 

At-least that's why we decided to stop by. Our server Lelaine was nice and attentive. I don't blame her for the remainder of my experience. The food along w/ the drinks were just awful. 

The bartender making the alcoholic beverages needs to take a step back and taste his/her own drinks. They were unbearable. With the exception of the mango margarita, the drinks we ordered were better off in the trash. 

The food wasn't any better. One minor inconvenience- had we not read through our entire bill, we would have been charged an extra $10 for a drink we didn't order. 

I think it's always best the server checks the receipt to ensure the bill is correct. Unfortunately, I'm sorry to say -  I'm sure there are much better places in the surrounding area.

I been going to this place off and on for years so I like it... however loud annoying soccer fans singing group songs at 9am is super whack. So much so that we left after driving 30 just to eat there...

Loved it - very fair prices - open for breakfast too- had a salmon sandwich for dinner -$9 and tasty - tired of fancy restaurants and the prices? check it out -they offer inside and outside seating- 1/2 block from convention center and across the street from the Hyatt

I stopped by for lunch at 1100 and they seemed a bit unprepared but my server Joshua came through like a champ.  He did a great job of taking care of me and was very friendly.  The Four Peaks Kilt Lifter was quite good as was the Monterey Grilled Chicken sandwich.

I have been here on and off when I'm in town for conventions.  The food is good quality, but the service is kinda wishy/washy.  This morning it took almost 8 minutes for me to be greeted/seated even though the restaurant was about a quarter full.  Another 8-10 minutes for them to take my order.  Satisfying meal, though my BLT was a little scant on the bacon.  Pretty affordable, but if you're in a hurry, go elsewhere.

I bought a Groupon for Steve's yesterday and took the boy out for dinner. 

At first I was very impressed. I love living in a city and the patio has that awesome downtown, surrounded by big buildings, busy feel. They had televisions so we could watch the basketball game, and misters so we could stay cool. (Great misting system by the way, not the annoying kind that just soaks everything.) 

I made sure to check up on Yelp to see how my fellow Yelpers felt about this place before stopping by. They only gave the place 3 stars, but all the reviews were pretty positive, so we gave it a whirle. 

Three stars is very accurate. Why?....
the good....
-cute fun ambiance
-nice big menu that can satisfy anyone
-very nice friendly staff
-great looking happy hour
-and there is a Groupon Now for more than 50% off - winning!
the bad....
-lousy service, not horrid, but slow and waitress couldn't be found sometimes
-a tinny bit on the expensive side - happy hour is the time to go!
-food was good, not great but good (specifically, cottage cheese was watered down and the mac'n'cheese had way too much chipotle spice in it)

Over all we had a good time, the people watching is great! There was a convention about to start for some wacko hippy spiritual liberal boarder hopping group. Ha-Lare-E-Os! 

I def recommend them, but try to get the Groupon or check out happy hour, and don't be in a hurry.

I've gotta say, nothing blew me away here.
Service: OK, correct food came out, but we sat for awhile before anyone came over and drink refills were nonexistent.
Food:ok, They were burgers.  Took awhile. 
Atmosphere:ok.  I guess.  It was a nice night, so we sat on the patio.  Which is sort of cave like.... I like the guy on the sidewalk playing his guitar...
See what I mean? I'm not fully on A-ok... not quite a Meh.... just ok.
Great spot for breakfast lunch or dinner. Right near the convention center, too. We enjoyed breakfast at a super reasonable price and all the food was delicious.

I was in the area for work. I was looking for a local shop to have a meal, and a local recommended this place to our group. It was divey. The food was pretty cheap and good! It was ok. I wasn't wowed.
This food is always great, but the place lacks management. Orders taken and then someone comes out to confirm them. Waiting for a salad for 30 mins. I'm

First time in Arizona arrived on Friday, March 2nd asked for fettuccine and asked for sundried tomatoes.   Didn't think it would be that difficult to add some sundried tomatoes to some noddles. Well yes no sundried tomatoes.  Than as me and friends are finishing up dinner a waiter accidentally dropped glasses of water on my back. He apologized which I understand accidents happen. But what shocked me was 1) the manager didn't even bother to come out to apologize and if manager wasn't there than the next person in charge should have also come out to apologize. But to my surprise he/she didn't. What a coward. 2) not even some type of discount was given.  Not that I needed it but being offered what would have been a nice gesture after they gave me a shower.  So for that they get 1/2 a star.

Travel weary and need of food - as I walked out my hotel heard some excellent acoustic music - enjoying some music ,  turns out it was $5 burger night - bonus -  California burger was juicy and the gauc and grilled onion perfect - i also tried the tortilla soup which i enjoyed. I also enjoyed the skinny crunchy fries and the chilled and crisp pickle The service was fast and friendly.  When i back to PHX and near the convention center I'll come again

Went here last night after my wife's Phoenix Symphony concert with about 12 of her friends.

Food came out very quickly. Ordered a Midori sour and calamari. Calamari was above average and $8.   

Staff was not overly friendly, but also we didn't feel like we were bothing the server either.

Fun/lively atomosphere

Kitchen closed down way too early (10 pm).

Bottom line, it was good, but not a must-visit place

I went to Steve's as part of the @downtownphoenix spring fling pub crawl.

It has a nice atmosphere, and I love the patio.

We were only there for about 30 minutes, but in that time, I was pleased with the level of service we received, and with the chips and salsa.

The chips are kinda different, almost like fried wontons in their texture. They were delicious. And the salsa had a nice flavor, and decent heat.

I was hoping to have breakfast after the crawl, but I was too exhausted (old) and had to head home long before that happened.

I will definitely go back to Steve's, and especially to try their breakfast menu.

(only 3 stars because I didn't get enough time or food experience yet)

Love the wings love the drink specials hate the service. It is almost impossible to get service in there you have to ask to be served. I come here often and deal with it 99% of the time but today I had had it I came in set for 10 minutes no one said anything then finally someone came and asked had I been help I told them know they told me they would be back 10 minutes later. Someone else walks in sitstwo seats down from me and gets served right away. I brought it to that servers attention and she said she didn't know which was understandable but as a customer coming on lunch it is frustrating the restaurant wasn't even busy it had two semi large parties and a few sprinkled here and there but that's all I've been there on busier days at busier times. Please step your service up so I can continue to be a customer

If you're staying downtown, convenient place from the major hotels. The food is good and well priced. Friendly staff makes the dining experience enjoyable. Tonight they had a guy playing 80's song  with a guitar outside.

This is a funky place, but awesome food! My friends and I ate here twice during a conference. Quick, tasty, and reasonable. 
Between us, we had crab cakes(who knew in Phoenix?), burgers, soup, salad, chicken strips, and the most amazing sampler platter I've  ever seen! Every dish was excellent.

Great place to grab a burger (or a veggie burger) and a beer downtown.  They have the best spicy onion rings, and a great veggie burger.  Of course they have like ten other burgers on the menu, as well as lots of chicken dishes, sandwiches, pasta and salads.

This restaurant has been open since the '70's, and as a result, you'll see many generations of people while you're there.  Great Grandma?  Grandma?  Mom? Dad? Little Susie?  Yep.  They're all there.
Nice Happy Hour spot in downtown Phoenix. Their Sunday brunch is good as well. Kind of a small establishment,. Nice friendly staff.

I can't believe I have lived in Downtown Phoenix for 4 years and I had never been to this place! I found Steve's after stumbling around Downtown looking for happy hour food after getting back after work. Man, was I impressed. I was excited to discover they have $6 gourmet burgers on Wednesday's. I ordered my bacon Burger medium and they cooked it perfectly. Not only was the food great, but the service was exceptional. They got me in and out of there in 15 minutes with a decent sized croud. What a great alternative to many of these other places that make you wait like an hour to get your food and don't even refill your beverege. Kudos to my waiter, Gordon, for doing a stellar job. I will be back again in a few Wednesday's. Highly recommend.
Chill bar atmosphere. Very large menu with lots to choose from. It was our servers first day and she did a fantastic job!

So. This was just a bad experience from the start. I stood st the podium for a solid 5-8 minutes no one greeted me so I just took a seat. Woman comes over brings me a menu and ask what I want to drink. She comes back with the drink and I ask her what the soup of the day is? She has no clue. So I ask her how much the "fish and chips" special is? Again crickets. I was then like okay can I just order a burger then? She then proceeds to tell me she is not a waitress but a hostess and that my waitress will be put in "a few". Ooookay. I wait another 5 minutes waitress comes to take order fine. In the mean time I watch not 1 but TWO other people get up and leave because no one is serving them. 20 minutes after waiting for my meal, the waitress sends over a bus boy to ask me what I had ordered  I dumbfoundedly repeat my order and away he goes. 10 more minutes goes by and I ask the hostess when my food will be out? Her reply "I don't know I'm not the waitress" and then goes back to her podium. Another 5 minutes go by and the bus boy brings me my food no other stops or refills were made to my table until I GOT UP and went to the counter for my check. Absolutely ridiculous and horrible service. The only reason they got 2 stars was because there food was actually good. I would avoid here if you want fast/friendly/ or knowledge employees
"Jo" was a great server!  Convinced one in our party to get the grilled fries NOT the french fries, and the spuds didn't disappoint! The New York steak sandwich was scrumptious!
Very slow.  Staff seems confused.  Several tables around us were complaining about the service.  At least it was a cool place to get out of the hellish phx summer.

This place has changed not the same anymore.Place,tables are dirty, appetizers are seasoned with lots of salt & pepper. The food is not cooked all the way, & the dishes were dirty, so servers took dishes & wipes off with their hands to clean, gross.
Parking is not free,not for kids

Came here in October 2008.
Happening place at night with kids singing their songs out near the patio.  Pretty good singer.  Convenient to staying around the convention area.
Staff is friendly.  Ate here for breakfast, 2 eggs for $5.00, toast for $2.00.  Pretty good.  I wanted pineapple and he went hunting for it for me because they usually give cantaloupe.  They have breakfast buffet sometimes also but I havent had that.  The spread looks pretty good though from waffles to sausage to bacon to eggs to potatoes, juices, etc.
Also had dinner here and it was pretty good.  Their speciality house potatoes are YUMMY.

Nope! This place has low stars for a reason. We never got to order because we were asked to leave, so I cannot comment on their food. But the services sucked! Don't waste your time! There are plenty of other places in the immediate vicinity.

Just left there with NO food as they paid no attention to me telling them I have a severe allergy to tomatoes that will place me in hospital (stop breathing). They served me  my hamburger with guacamole with chopped tomatoes in it. The waiter said that they normally don't have tomato in it ( did not make me feel safe at all). He graciously said he wasn't going to charge me...nice right, wonder if they would of paid for the helicopter ride to the hospital. They did charge the person I was with for her meal-- you would think the manager (who decided to bill her) would of not charged our table since they ruined our meal out. Besides, the food is basic and pre made. Safe your money and go elsewhere -- this place has no customer service, unkept atmosphere.

I have to agree with the reviewers here. This place is just not good. 

We went there before a Suns game because every other place was packed. Steve's was empty and now I know why. I ordered their signature Green House Pasta, which was one of the blandest things I'd ever eaten. Our server was so scatterebrained and running all over the restaurant that he forgot part of my order and I still can't figure out why. He didn't appear to have any other tables.....???? He kept saying "be right with you guys" every time he left. Uhm, are you trying to tell us that You'll be back? or that you'll see us when you see us? I'm so confused... did you forget that you already helped us?

This restaurant solely survives on business from Hyatt and Wyndham guests that stumble outside and see the first place they can eat. I told our server that I thought my food was awful, and I ate it anyway because I didn't have time to wait for another item nor did I want to risk my food. 

One thing I noticed is the menu says "we use fresh fish as often as possible." What the fuck? So what if you can't get fresh fish? you're going to serve me something less than that? How about "we only use the freshest fish." Or truly, do you sometimes serve unfresh fish?

Came here for lunch with time to kill before heading to the airport. An incredibly beautiful October afternoon with temps going up, sitting outside in the shade was delightful, including the many birds and people-watching from this excellent location.

I was seated promptly, it was $6 burger day, so why not? My sweet and seemingly feisty waitress helped me figure out which one (the Cowboy Burger, and it was great), with a $3 on tap Blue Moon beer. Served on a camping type plate, this was just casual enough, and inexpensive enough but delicious enough to last a long time. 

This is perfect for watching sports and hanging around downtown. Think World Series!

I read previous reviews about the staff. I experienced some confusion when delivering my beer, but when I asked the hostess, I found her delightful and helpful. The confused busser was equally kind. My waitress? Great personality and attentive service! 

It's a casual place and I'd recommend it with enthusiasm.

I am not too fond of the dinner experience here, but it is a great place to grab lunch. Lots of choices and generous portions. Steve's is inexpensive for an eatery in the heart of downtown.

Note the cute quotations on the walls.

Great wings! Order extra crispy. Tried teriyaki and hot - both good enjoyed teriyaki more. 2nd time had seafood jambalasta, pretty good. Boyfriend had chipotle Mac and cheddar thought that was really good. Soup of day was loaded baked potatoe which was AMAZING!! from CA so next time I'm in town will def go there.

Awful place !!! We went after a baseball game and it's was packed. 30 minutes waiting for a table. The host was dumb. She had not idea what she was doing. I ordered a chicken sandwich and it was cold and horrible. My partner got spaghetti primavera and he got spaghetti pesto instead. Never again

Steve's Greenhouse Grill was a decent lunch spot in downtown. The menu had something for everybody: salads, soups, hot and cold sandwiches, wraps, and burgers. It was a sunny day so my group chose to sit in the patio. The patio was a popular choice and it quickly filled up during peak lunch hour. 

I ordered the grilled salmon sandwich with fruit. (Alternatively, sandwiches and burgers came with choice of tater tots, fries, house potatoes, cottage cheese or cole slaw.) The salmon was cooked just right, although tasted very plain. Good thing the sandwich came with a side of chipotle remoulade for dipping. The sauce spiced up my sandwich. It was a satisfying meal overall and the portion size was perfect for me.

As for service, I thought the hostess who seated my group was trying to force us to sit inside. (No one was sitting inside the restaurant at the time.) She didn't even ask if we wanted to sit in the patio and I insisted that we did, had even pointed out an open table initially, but she had walked away so fast with the menus that she missed our motion. However, our actual waitress was very pleasant and welcoming. We enjoyed her bright and cheery personality.

Price: $10.

Smoking "in the corners" outside...what a joke.  Nobody wants to smell your shit.  They need to fix that, asap.

That said, the drinks weren't bad, but the street tacos were awful.  The carne asada must have been marinated in water, because the only flavor I got was that of a griddle that hasn't been cleaned in a long time.

Let me start with the reason I'm giving this place three stars and not two. $3 Blue Moon on tap. That is a beautiful thing. If you're just coming here for drinks you'll be happy assuming you ever get them. We've been here twice now while Phoenix Comicon was going on. It's crowded and noisy but you have to expect that. It's also a little expensive but everything is in downtown Phoenix. It also can take a while to get service and your food. Again, I'd be okay with that if the food seemed like it was not just slapped on a plate in the most haphazard way possible. I ordered a chicken taco salad last night. When I eventually got it, it tasted good but it did not contain a single piece of chicken! I didn't bother to tell the waiter because even though I'm on vacation I don't feel like waiting an hour. The previous time I got the drunken chicken sandwich which looked like it was assembled by an actual drunk.  I mean, fine, if you're going to serve mediocre food that's one thing but don't charge as much as everyone else in the area. I wouldn't recommend getting anything more than an appetizer here, but next time I'm in Phoenix and it's over 100 degrees I'd still probably go in for the Blue Moon.

Our party of eight came in to an empty place to celebrate my birthday.  We sat outside to enjoy the live music which consisted of a guy playing a guitar.  We ordered food and drinks and were enjoying ourselves until the resident street people came around ...along with the owners.  As the woman owner walked in she appeared to try and become confrontational with us but then went inside.  Just after that, our party was told we wouldn't be served anymore and were cut off.  After we explained that none of us were driving they graciously let us stay for a brownie with a candle in it. We were then told we had to leave after I went in to talk to the waitress and the male owner tried to stop and listen to what I was saying to her which made me stop talking until he walked away.  That's when we were cut off.  It was a clear and vulgar display of power. It seemed as though the owners bought a bar so that they and their friends could drink.  I can see now why it was empty.  Good luck with that.
Great place to spot for a drink or quick bite to eat while downtown.

Ate here while at a conference that was heald at the hyatt. 

Food was good, prices fair, good atmosphere. service was very good the first day and marginal the second.

I will definatly eat here agin.

So we came there two days for comicon. They had some awesome deals on drinks and food so me and my mom decided to enjoy some food. Both days we had just horrible servers. The first one acted like he didn't really wanna even be there. And the second one was just never there. The food and the drinks ended up being delicious. We got the margarita deal for comicon and perfect size and perfectly made. Buffalo burger was spot on perfect. And today we got appetizers the white pizza and shrimp wontons. Like I said everything tastes good. But service was bad. The second guy apologized because their co2 broke for their pop machine and were like it's all good. But why did it involve him specifically and not anyone else. Why couldn't you hand us off to someone else to finish up while you fixed the problem. All the other tables looked like they had better servers for some reason. But like I said I would come back for the food and not the service.

Awful service and food just so so. Orders mixed up, think items omitted.  I had the eggs and meatloaf.  Potatoes tasted bad and no toast given.  Spent a lot of time looking for our waitress.  Been in several times before and always satisfied.  Very, very disappointed this time.

Horrible service, rude staff. I felt slightly racially profiled. Never coming back. I've been to this location several times and each time I've gone it's been the same thing. It's almost like they treat certain guests a bit more attentively.

Great food at a reasonable price!! Head over and ask for Betty Boop!! She'll treat you right! The chicken cordon bleu is amazing! Check out the patio seating on a comfortable Arizona night!! Thursdays bring about $0.50 wing night, and the sweet honey chipotle is so good! A must stop for good food and friendly people!!

Worst service ever. Came in at 10:45am was given breakfast menus and was then ignored for 20 minutes. Had to get up to find a server who then informed us we aren't serving breakfast anymore because its 11:05. WTF? We sat here waiting for someone to take our order for 20 min. At that point we left. I would give negative stars if i could. It wasn't busy at all. I guess they don't like making money or serving food. Which is an odd policy for a restaurant.
I love this place! Great patio and an amazing staff!!! Best food and drinks specials in downtown Phoenix.

This place SUCKS! No service whatsoever. So disappointed. No wonder we got in right away. BS. I suggested they were understaffed and they assured me they weren't. The bartender wouldn't even sErve me. He assured me the server would be right with me. I will never ever be back this is ridiculous!

Ate here on a Sunday afternoon. Nice clean place, friendly staff & good food. Our waitress was excellent. She put a rush in another customer's order so they would not be late for their flight that afternoon. 

Had a burger & fries. The Shoestring fries are awesome!

Cool place to eat and have a beer or two. Maybe even catch a game. My friend and I came on a less busier afternoon. We had a pretty funny, cool entertaining waiter. Food was good with our mandarin salad and veggie patty burger. The waiter was nice enough to have our meals split and everything for us. Only 4 stars because we really didn't have anyone check up on us at all and it took forever for him to bring the bill, run our cards etc....

This place is awesome! For us it's a nice change of pace, big city dinning. Great food, cold beer and friendly staff. Sit on the patio to get that cooling breeze and listen to the latest musician. Oh, and $5 burgers on Wednesday!!!

Meeh it is just ok.  But I have only ever been here for thier buffet breakfast between 1am and 3am after Pub Crawling downtown.  They manage to work with large crowds well and the food is typical of a hot breakfast buffet.  

I can't speak for their regular menu items, but I do hear they offer a Happy Hour appetizer buffet that I may have to check out sometime.

After a 5 hour flight from Buffalo to Phoenix (excluding layover time), I anticipated eating at Steve's Greenhouse Grill. Judging by my research on what appeared to be a fresh, lively joint, I was more than ready to check it out once I got settled in my hotel. I was seated promptly and brought an iced water soon after. So far so good. Things quickly began to go downhill after I ordered a beer on tap which was brought to me lukewarm...in a plastic cup. The menu was extensive and offered several unique, funky dishes. I decided on the meatloaf dinner but had to change my order since I was informed by my server they were all out. Despite the large offering of menu items, I went for chicken fingers and fries. My server was kind enough to substitute fries for tater tots upon my request. The dish's description claimed it came with your choice of dipping sauce, so when I asked my server for a side of chipotle bbq sauce, he looked at me like I had just asked him for his first-born child. I retracted and asked if it would be all to have that as a side and he said, "well, we normally just serve it with ranch..." He obliged, however, to serve the fingers with the sauce. As he walked away with the menu I directed his attention back to my table and reminded him that a salad came with the meal. He double-checked the menu and confirmed that I was correct.

When the main dish came out, I immediately knew the chicken fingers came frozen from a box. I was expecting homemade chicken fingers, but despite this small setback, I do think frozen chicken fingers are acceptable if they are, well, good. They were small and soggy and obviously were not cooked long enough.  This explained why my food came out so quickly. I was never asked by my server if I needed a refill on my water or my beer. Instead, he cleared my plate and immediately brought my check over, thanked me, and wished me a goodnight. This was completely unacceptable and above all, ruined my entire dining experience at Steve's. My server was not outright rude to me or had a bad attitude, he was just extremely neglectful, had zero personality, and was not very personable. He was too wrapped up in doing his job which shouldn't be a criticism by any means because that's what he should be doing. He was, however, too calculated and did not make me feel welcomed whatsoever, which in my opinion should be every server's main priority. Overall, I was severely disappointed with the food and server at Steve's. Drinks and food were delivered at a fast, efficient pace, though but the bad ultimately outweighed the good.

I have to start off by saying, I only created an account on Yelp to give this terrible restaurant a review. 
This was my 2nd visit to this restaurant; I was hoping my first experience was maybe that we just caught them on a bad day. 
To start out, the hostess told us there were no seats inside, that the inside tables were only for large parties so we had to sit outside (it was 108 and smelled like nasty beer and mildew). We decided to sit anyway mainly because all the other restaurants near by were packed. Then literally right after she seated us we watched her seat 2 other separate parties of 2 INSIDE! 
The tables were dirty, my arms stuck to ours. The glass O' silverware and the salt and pepper shakers were filthy! Like a layer of grey dirt on them. Then it took 20 minutes for anyone to even acknowledge we were sitting there, I asked the people at the table next to us who the server was and when I asked the girl she states she's not our server and walks back INSIDE! Finally a girl comes to take our drink orders. I wanted to order everything right away because I was afraid nobody would come back (this happened my 1st time visiting as well) and the girl tells me she's not our server either! Seriously?? So we get our drinks, The beer was warm, had a weird odor and had a soured taste. It was bad. I'm guessing their kegs aren't being stored at the correct temperature. So our waitress finally comes out, she was very nice but she disappeared a lot and we had to wait a long time to get beer refills. I found out later that our waitress had been going to stand in the walk in cooler in between checking on the tables (she actually told us this). We got our food after what felt like forever and it was nothing special, not enough seasoning and my tater tots also had onion rings and French fries in it which I'm guessing is because they don't clean their deep fryer.
Overall, this place is bad :( I will never go back and I will make sure to let everyone I know not to eat there either.

The first thing I would say about this place is don't judge a book by its cover. It looks like a dive bar, but the breakfast was surprisingly good. My wife's poached eggs were done perfectly and our fruit was freshly cut. The toast options were minimal, but that seems to be the standard the further south you get. Unless you want a biscuit. But we didn't. 

My Greek omelet was slightly smaller than I had hoped, and it tasted like it might have been made with liquid egg, but it was really good. The cheese was fresh and it wasn't greasy. My English muffin was toasted well done just like I like it.
We had great service and drank cheap. $3.00 Mai tais all day and happy hour beers made this a great afternoon. Our server Frank was funny and very attentive. Love this place and will return!

Awkward. Is the best way to explain this place. We went there at about 230pm on a Saturday. It was not busy.   The bartender said hello then walked right by us to talk to the wait staff. He kept talking to them while attempting to take our order.  The wait staff hung out by the bar and bashed their customers the whole time.  

I'm amazed this place is in business...didn't try the food and we didn't dare...

Also, kinda weird that you have to walk through the kitchen to use the bathroom.

Stopped by here for a quick breakfast because it was right next door to the Hyatt! We were promptly greeted by a waitress and seated outside, which was great on a sunny morning. The prices are FANTASTIC and the portions are big. Service was fast and the food(I ordered a BELT with a side of fruit) was great. I definitely recommend Steve's for a quick and cheap meal, especially if you are staying next door at the Hyatt.
The Chili Mac Sundae was tasty! Best skins I've had! Good price for great food. Wings will be next to try, heard Honey Hot Wings are the best.

Steve's, one of Downtown's oldest diners, hosted the after-hours breakfast during Saturday's Downtown Pub Crawl and bravo to the management and staff for recognizing the tremendous opportunity the event presented. 

That night Steve's was transformed from a quaint lunch spot into an open-air discotheque. Amazing.

The patio was packed with Crawlers enjoying their breakfast and dancing to crowd-pleasers like Cupid's "Shuffle" and LMFAO's "Shots," with a beer in one hand and yummy bacon in the other. There were moments when I actually forgot where I was and I was sober as a judge!

The $5.95 breakfast was perfect and the staff was super friendly considering the mass of drunken humanity it was dealing with until 3 a.m.

Great job, Steve's!

Crab cakes blew!  When we asked if they were good, got a strange look and less than reassuring reply for waitress.  I suppose if you can't say anything good, don't say anything at all.  Hellish water!!!  Margarita was tasty.  Big zero, not going back.

The meat on the burger was paper thin! I was shocked when she brought it out! The bacon on the burger was also VERY thin. Did not taste good. 
I figured "well you can't ruin French fries at least" - wrong. Burnt- looked like they scooped up the left over pieces of fries at the bottom of the bag and threw them into the fryer.

Update: the hostess is turning people away saying "sorry we are closed for 20 minutes because there's too many customers and not enough servers." There's tons of tables open. Customers are asking "well can we just sit and wait." Her response: "no. I'll get in trouble by my manager."
This is bizarre and very awkward - can't wait to get the HELL out of here.

The only good thing about this restaurant is the location. The service, menu, and food are just mediocre (on a good day). They have a lot of potential, especially by being at such a great location. Steve's Greenhouse would be a great candidate for one of those restaurant makeover shows.

Good food decent prices. My boyfriend had the NY Steak Sandwich with no complaints. I had the Tuscan Chicken Breast. Very juicy and seasoned. The seasoned veggies served with it are good as well. Good service. We went on a Groupon but will definitely be back.

This looked really good on YELP. NOT!!  Service is abysmal. 4 tables and 2 servers and I waited almost 12mins before someone came to take my order. Another 15 mins before food arrived. The Denver omelette was okay not great. Server never came back to check on me, I wanted some jam for my toast. After about 15-20 mins I got up and got it myself from the bar!! Someone else finally took my dishes away, didn't ask if I needed anything else. Now I'm sitting here with the check, another 15-20 mins and no one has taken my money yet. Oh and they want cash only. Big city on a St Patrick's Day weekend.

We were seeing a show at Comerica on a Sunday and discovered that many restaurants in the area don't open on this day!  We bought a group on and hoped that we would be one of the people who had a 4/5 star experience and not a 1.
Waitress was very nice and food was prepared adequately.  They were helpful when we asked a couple of questions.  
Honestly, I think what people mind is the décor-we realize that it's a sports bar, but the patio was not ideal to sit in, the inside felt as if it could use a major facelift and they had their paper products (cups, napkins, etc) in full view of all the customers.
Someone was right there to seat us immediately.  it was an okay experience
Had the fish tacos! Best ever!! Yummy! Yummy!! Great food, great price, great service!!

Stopped at this place cuz it was every close to the conference center.  I dropped in twice - once for lunch and another time for dinner.  The street tacos are fabulous and I highly recommend them.  The sirloin steak was ok, a bit tough but cooked perfectly and had a good flavor.  The tatertots were deep fried and golden and the local IPA was ice cold.  Together = heaven
Fabulous food, reasonable prices, and the service is outstanding! What a wonderful experience, outside or inside dining, and live music! Really, check this place out. You won't be sorry!

Was in Phoenix for a Gold Canyon convention. This became our go to place. The 1st day our lunch service was horrible..very rude waitress. Erica. My food was so so. Chicken sandwich dry, no flavor.We noticed they had some specials that night so we came back. We had bartender helping us. He was great. 50¢ wings! Fantastic..the honey hot are the best wings ever, tarot tots...yum! And the watermelon margaritas and the long island iced tea are the best ive had. This place is definitely the BEST choice around the convention center. A little rough around the edges but for some reason we kept going back and I'd continue to do so during my next convention.

I had a pretty good time here.  We came here after a preseason game for drinks and sat out on the patio.  The service was great.  Its in a pretty cool part of town that you can sit, relax and enjoy the "downtown vibe"  From there you can walk to several other places.  We didn't eat but everything that came out of the kitchen looked great. Seems like a place where a lot of fans come before the game as the arena is a short walk away. Worth checking out.

This place was across the street from my hotel and I was tired so I decided to give it a try. The fish tacos were good and there was a lot of food for $9.50. I went early so the service was good at the bar. The one thing that disturbed me was that they were having a business conversation in the middle of the restaurant. Talking abut who paid what bill and such things. Extremely unprofessional, go to the office for such discussions.

Pretty much what everyone else has experienced here on service.
Had to ask for:
1. Utensils
2. Remind waitress to bring water that we asked for
3. Ask if my meal came with soup or salad rather than just what waitress offered which were just the starch options
After delivering food never came back to check on us other than just give use the check.  When I decided to take the check up to expedite things I couldn't find waitress.  Tried to give it to another waitress running out the back area only to be totally brushed off. WTF?!
BUT, two stars for the decent food.  The meatloaf wasn't bad, the green salad was fresh and hearty, and the burger and fries weren't bad either.  
For some weird reason service in Phoenix as a whole has been terrible.  Maybe it'll get better as our week here continues.
I'm guess there are other choices to eat at than Steve's given the fact that they've had many poor reviews about service and haven't done anything to rectify the problems.
This place is average.  The food does come out quick, but that's about it.  Not bad, but nothing you'll recommend to others.

I went because a) it was across the street & I didn't want to walk too far in the 90 degree heat; b) the menu sounded interesting and maybe a little offbeat; & c) the concierge at the Hyatt Regency said it was really good (no accounting for taste). 

I waited at the the sign that said 'Please wait to be seated' & I waited & waited &... Finally I walked into the main restaurant & asked to be seated. The hostess said "Oh,I didn't see you". I guess 10' was too far for her vision in the  less than 1/2 filled place or maybe she was too busy socializing. 

I started with a nice, not great, brew - Devil's ale or something - at the rec of my waiter. I then ordered Chico's meatloaf, the chef 'signature' dish. It is tasteless meat lying on a bed of tasteless soggy fried potatoes & covered with nice but nothing special marinara sauce. It came with two spiceless spicy cajun onion rings and 'eh' enchilada soup of the day. Service was good & the price was right $20.00 with tip but the food & ambiance was lacking.
So if you want an OK nothing special inexpensive meal then it will fill the bill. Otherwise as noted in my tip: Don't go there.

My gf and gave this place three tries as we felt it was only fair. The food was 3 stars each time, no biggie as it is cheap and reasonably priced. The service, however has been regretfully terrible each time. EACH TIME we waited 8-10 minutes before we were even greeted by our servers. At one visit it was actually 17 minutes from entry before we were even brought our drinks. The servers never come to see how your food is or to refill drinks. Twice, I've had to ask them to prebus the table. Twice, it has taken the server 10 minutes to actually run our card and return the bill to us. It's disappointing, we live 2 blocks away and have been looking for a place like this to call our home away from home. Decent food, decent price, terrible service every time. Will not be going back.

Ok.... So the only reason I even went to this place was because I didn't want to re-park my car after I found out "Cartel" was a breakfast joint.... In hindsight, I should have re parked my car. 

This place is so very amazingly and exceptionally average. As in like, my stomach was full but not because the food was so good I couldn't help but to eat every last bite, as much it was because I only had an hour for
lunch. Wife ordered a "tortilla soup" and some type of healthy rice and grilled veggie meal. The soup was barely edible (salty, over spiced and FULL of corn) and the rice was reheated from cold storage and the grilled veggies were soggy. My Reuben was edible. That's about where that stops but for full disclosure purposes, I'm a bit of a Reuben snob. (See former reviews of the Reuben at Windsor) My daughters burger was meh. Fries and tater toys were deep fried in the same grease that was not only old and badly needed to be changed but also used to fry the fish they were serving for the fish and chips. Gross!! Fishy tasting fries! 
 
Service was below average. Waitress not only had a huge case of the "idontgivadamns" but wasn't anywhere to be found except to drop off food and take Initial order.  Decor was dated. I could go on and on. I won't return and I highly recommend going anywhere else downtown besides this place. Hell, the hot dog guy on the corner of Jefferson and central is a 100% improvement from this joint.

Don't know why the low stars, this place is friendly, has good food, super drink specials and has the nicest staff. Found out that my server Mo was also the Manager. Nicest person on earth. Made sure my coffee cup was filled and we got a chance to chat during slow times. My breakfast  (Denver omlete) was excellent!! Exactly how I like it. Price was very reasonable. Can't go wrong eating or drinking at Steve's Greenhouse Grill

Got a voucher for half off so we used it as a date night.  Hubby's chowder pretty salty, the mere suggestion of cole slaw and his fish & chips were so-so.  I had the California chicken sandwich, fries and blackberry lemonade.  Delicious.  Waitress a gem and the downtown vibe is sweet.  Worth the trip and might be someplace I would go aftet a function downtown.

Average at best... After a solid 10 min, our server finally came over. We ordered the sampler to start, to which he responded "I don't think we will be able to do that since we're busy" ummm... So you stop cooking once you get busy? P.s. they were not busy. The food was fine. Nothing to write home about, but not bad.
Convenient early morning breakfast before your convention, with seating outdoors too.

I've been to Steve's a handful of times, including for special events like their Mother's Day Brunch last year and the pub crawl breakfast.  

They are pretty busy during lunch and happy hour, though their happy hour never really struck me as appealing.

Over the years, I have tried many items at Steve's, including their Ostrich burger.  I've decided Steve's does breakfast best.  

Service can be great if you get the right server in the right mood.  Sometimes you get the best, most pleasant service.  Otherwise, you're SOL.  There seems to be no in between!  

Will I go to Steve's again?  Most certainly.  Will I make a special trip out just to eat here?  Nah.

Buffalo burger was really dry. Beer was good & they accommodate a group of 8 but it was so boring. I didn't enjoy a dry $12 burger but Frank, our waiter, was nice. Also cheese is an extra dollar, so is peppers, etc...  Took forever to get the bill.

Can't review the food. Hostess very slow to get to front door as it must of been too hot on patio. Another 10 minutes to get watered down lemonade n watery tea. Waited n waited for server. So we walked out. Too many teenage workers and no adult supervision on site
